docs.abstract: Police in Bangladesh killed seven members of a gang of armed robbers on Monday during a raid on their hideout on a hillside overlooking a camp for Rohingya refugees in the southeast of the country, a police spokesman said.
docs.snippet: Police in Bangladesh killed seven members of a gang of armed robbers on Monday during a raid on their hideout on a hillside overlooking a camp for Rohingya refugees in the southeast of the country, a police spokesman said.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA — Police in Bangladesh killed seven members of a gang of armed robbers on Monday during a raid on their hideout on a hillside overlooking a camp for Rohingya refugees in the southeast of the country, a police spokesman said.

headline.main: Bangladesh Police Kill Seven Suspected Rohingya Robbers in Raid
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Police Kill Seven Suspected Rohingya Robbers in Raid

docs.abstract: Bangladesh is reconsidering a plan to relocate Rohingya refugees to a flood-prone island located hours by boat from its coast, junior minister for disaster management and relief Enamur Rahman told Reuters on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: Bangladesh is reconsidering a plan to relocate Rohingya refugees to a flood-prone island located hours by boat from its coast, junior minister for disaster management and relief Enamur Rahman told Reuters on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA — Bangladesh is reconsidering a plan to relocate Rohingya refugees to a flood-prone island located hours by boat from its coast, junior minister for disaster management and relief Enamur Rahman told Reuters on Wednesday.

headline.main: Bangladesh Rethinks Plan to Move Rohingya Refugees to Island: Minister
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Rethinks Plan to Move Rohingya Refugees to Island: Minister

docs.abstract: Getting ready for a disaster is still a tiny part of the world’s response to the likelihood of one. But some governments and officials are starting to plan well in advance.
docs.snippet: Getting ready for a disaster is still a tiny part of the world’s response to the likelihood of one. But some governments and officials are starting to plan well in advance.
docs.lead_paragraph: Disaster relief works like this: There is a flood, a drought, an earthquake, a famine, an exodus of refugees. Reporters swarm in, broadcasting images of suffering. Humanitarian workers on the ground analyze who needs what relief and draw up plans. The government asks for help. The United Nations coordinates international pledges. Relief comes in — money, bags of grain, medical supplies.

headline.main: To Survive Disaster, Plan for the Worst

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies

docs.abstract: Over the years, villagers who live near Greece's border with Turkey got used to seeing small groups of people enter their country illegally. The Greek residents often offered the just-arrived newcomers a bite to eat and directed them to the nearest police or railway station.
docs.snippet: Over the years, villagers who live near Greece's border with Turkey got used to seeing small groups of people enter their country illegally. The Greek residents often offered the just-arrived newcomers a bite to eat and directed them to the neares...
docs.lead_paragraph: AMORIO, Greece — Over the years, villagers who live near Greece's border with Turkey got used to seeing small groups of people enter their country illegally. The Greek residents often offered the just-arrived newcomers a bite to eat and directed them to the nearest police or railway station.

headline.main: Greek Villagers Enlisted to Catch Migrants at Turkey Border
headline.print_headline: Greek Villagers Enlisted to Catch Migrants at Turkey Border

docs.abstract: The Rana Plaza collapse, which killed over 1,100 garment workers, led to much better labor conditions. Now that legacy could be in jeopardy, as a power struggle unfolds over factory safety.
docs.snippet: The Rana Plaza collapse, which killed over 1,100 garment workers, led to much better labor conditions. Now that legacy could be in jeopardy, as a power struggle unfolds over factory safety.
docs.lead_paragraph: As she walked to her job as a garment worker, Rima Khatun was passing the Natural Sweater Village on the outskirts of Dhaka, Bangladesh, when a gas boiler exploded inside. A wall of the two-story factory crashed onto a nearby sidewalk, injuring 10 pedestrians.

headline.main: After Factory Disaster, Bangladesh Made Big Safety Strides. Are the Bad Days Coming Back?
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh, a Fashion Hub, Grapples With Factory Safety

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Accord on Fire and Building Safety in Bangladesh

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Assn

docs.abstract: Across the north, including New Delhi, plunging temperatures have caused a run on shelters in a region more used to extreme heat.
docs.snippet: Across the north, including New Delhi, plunging temperatures have caused a run on shelters in a region more used to extreme heat.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — A brutal cold wave has swept northern India, blanketing streets in freezing fog, intensifying pollution, disrupting hundreds of flights and prompting school closures.

headline.main: India Cold Wave Breaks Records, Shuts Schools and Makes Bad Air Worse
headline.print_headline: India Shivers and Gags In a Foul-Air Cold Wave

byline.original: By Hari Kumar and Sameer Yasir

docs.abstract: Mr. Abed gave up a job as a senior executive at a multinational company to start BRAC after he saw his native land, Bangladesh, devastated by war.
docs.snippet: Mr. Abed gave up a job as a senior executive at a multinational company to start BRAC after he saw his native land, Bangladesh, devastated by war.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fazle Abed, who started a temporary relief effort for refugees in Bangladesh that became one of the largest nongovernmental organizations in the world, died on Dec. 20 in a hospital in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh. He was 83.

headline.main: Fazle Abed, Founder of a Leading Relief Agency, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Fazle Abed, 83, Founder of a Relief Agency in Bangladesh

docs.abstract: Elections are about finding compromise among people with vastly different desires.
docs.snippet: Elections are about finding compromise among people with vastly different desires.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2020 election season in the United States, which enters a new phase Monday, with the Iowa Democratic caucuses, will probably be among the most divisive and contentious in American history. The results will reverberate around the world, and will most likely shape the global order for years to come. As the political temperature rises to the boiling point, people on all sides should reflect on what democratic elections actually are.

headline.main: You Can Vote. But You Can’t Choose What Is True.

docs.abstract: As a global refugee crisis sped up and spread out, curators at a New Mexico museum spent two years reshaping a show about people on the move.
docs.snippet: As a global refugee crisis sped up and spread out, curators at a New Mexico museum spent two years reshaping a show about people on the move.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of our latest Museums special section, which focuses on the intersection of art and politics.

headline.main: Bringing Human Migration Closer to Home

docs.abstract: As the coronavirus hits Europe, questions arise about dependency on China, the risks of air travel, climate change and a new racism in populist politics.
docs.snippet: As the coronavirus hits Europe, questions arise about dependency on China, the risks of air travel, climate change and a new racism in populist politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Globalization, that awkward catchall for our interconnectedness, was already under assault from populists, terrorists, trade warriors and climate activists, having become an easy target for much that ails us.

headline.main: Spread of Virus Could Hasten the Great Coming Apart of Globalization
headline.print_headline: A New Plague Highlights the Extent, and the Risks, of Globalization
